info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 8:20PM EDT until August 29 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including parks, greenways, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have departed the Charlotte metro and only areas of light rain remains. These thunderstorms produced 1.25-2.25 inches of rainfall in about 60 minutes, resulting in excessive runoff and rapid rises on small streams and drainages in the area. Stewart Creek and the headwaters of Irwin Creek and Little Sugar Creek all have exceeded bankfull/Action Stage and are currently flooding adjacent low-lying areas. These streams have not yet crested but the rate of rise is slowing and crests will occur in the next 30 minutes. Thereafter, expect a fast recession below Action Stage/bankfull with improving conditions after 9 PM. The Flood Advisory will continue until streams receded below critical levels. Please avoid all area streams until flows recede. Flooding of Stewart Creek, Irwin Creek, and Little Sugar Creek greenways is ongoing. Expect flooding along Stewart Creek near Southwest Blvd, Lasalle St, and Carrier Dr. Flooding of Seversville and MLK Jr. community parks is ongoing. Irwin Creek is flooding Allen Hills and Double Oaks neighborhood parks and adjacent areas. Little Sugar Creek is flooding Cordella Community Park and Alexander Neighborhood Park and adjacent areas. - Some locations that may continue to experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, East Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, West Concord, Belmont, Pineville, Harrisburg, Freedom Park, The Plaza, Southpark Mall, Hidden Valley, Paw Creek, The Arboretum, Reedy Creek Park and University City. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
